intro: Anisophyllum dentatum, commonly known as the toothed leaf fern, is a unique plant with distinctive botanical features. It is a member of the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its compound, pinnate fronds that have a serrated or toothed margin. The plant produces spores rather than seeds, which are released from specialized structures called sori located on the underside of its leaves. Its fronds are typically dark green and can grow to a considerable length, making it a striking addition to moist, shaded environments. Anisophyllum dentatum is often found in temperate regions and thrives in humid, well-drained soils.
